thread.title: AMA fails to elect Presiding Member
thread.title_full: AMA fails to elect Presiding Member

title: AMA fails to elect Presiding Member
text:
Politics | 16 October 2015 23:00 CET AMA fails to elect Presiding Member By GNA 
Accra, Oct. 16, GNA - Members of the Accra Metropolitan Assembly (AMA) on Thursday failed to elect a Presiding Member to steer the affairs of the Assembly. 
This follows the inability of the two contestants - Mr Desmond Addo Biney and Mr Thomas Ashong, to get the required two-thirds of the 126 member Assembly, as stipulated by law. 
Mr Biney had 44 votes whilst Mr Ashong got 65 votes, with four members absent. 
The election has been postponed to next week,Thursday, October 22. 
Mr Alexander Poku Akubia, the Greater Accra Director of the Electoral Commission told the Ghana News Agency that, to win the Presiding Member seat one is required by law to obtain 84 votes, representing the two-thirds of the total votes cast. 
He explained that the 13 Members of Parliament (MPs), who are ex-officio members of the assembly do not have voting rights. 
'Even if the four who failed to turn up had voted none of them would still get the 84 votes,' Mr Poku-Akubia said. 
Mr Ashong, one of the contestants appealed to Parliament to amend the law to allow MPs to vote in the assembly election. 
He said: 'If the MPs had voted plus the four absentees, I would have won hands down.' 
GNA
